title: Drawing, "Tablet with an inscription"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. The inscription is written in a central rectangle with a more elaborate frame having spirals above, on top of outwards turned cherubim, at the sides, and moldings on top. In the upper band is a Maltese cross. Below the frame is an escutcheon-like console with an inner escutcheon. The whole is surrounded by a garland springing from the mouth of a mask and ending there. Laterally framed by leaves of two crossed branches. The paper next to it, at left and at right is colored. Written below, at right, by the artist: "In triplicata/propozzione". On the reverse, part of two pen sketches.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Tablet with an inscription".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1841.
